intro: Ardisia artemata, commonly known as the red-flowered ardisia, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Myrsinaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and striking red berries. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its flowers are small, clustered, and usually white or pale pink, while the berries are an attractive red color. Ardisia artemata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
